desmoj.core.report

Class Reporter

  • java.lang.Object
    • desmoj.core.report.Reporter
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AccumulateReporter, AggregateReporter, BerthReporter, BinReporter, BlockReporter, BoolStatisticReporter, CondQueueReporter, CountReporter, DataListHistogramReporter, DistributionReporter, EntrepotReporter, FlexReporterBuilder.FlexReporter, HistogramAccumulateReporter, HistogramReporter, ModelReporter, ProcessQueueReporter, QueueReporter, RegressionReporter, ResourceReporter, SmartReporter, StandardReporter, StockReporter, TableReporter, TallyReporter, TextHistogramReporter, TransportReporter, WaitQueueReporter, WorkStationReporter, YardReporter

    public abstract class Reporter
extends java.lang.Object
    Declares the basic methods needed for reporter to be able to print reports about a model component. Since individual components need individual reports each component has to specify a special reporter to print its data. Derive from this class to implement the reporter for the specific Reportable class.
    See Also:
    Reportable

    • Field Detail

      • groupID

        protected int groupID
        The group-id of the reporters of this class. This ID resembles group-identification and ordering information inside a group. The HTML output classes order Reporters by groups of hundred ID numbers. So i.e. all Distributions have Reporters with GroupID's in the range between 100 and 199. Highest numbers are always listed first. If in a sequence of Reporters its GroupID is in another century range, the HTML output will automatically insert a horizontal ruler and a new heading to indicate the new group of Reportable ModelComponents.

        Reserved GroupID ranges
        GroupID range Reportables
        2147483647 ModelReporter. Highest number possible, so always first in order. Ensures that SubModelReporter will be printed before other Reportables in the main model report.
        2000000000 SimulationrunReporter, including Experiment duration and other important information referring to the experiment as whole.
        1800 + Free for additional Reporters of new constructs that will be listed before the StatisticObjects used in a Model.
        1300 - 1799 Reporters for StatisticObjects as the Accumulate, Tally, TextHistogram, Histogram, Regression and Count, which will be listed before the process synchronisation constructs used in the Model.
        400 - 1299 Additional Reporters for process synchronisation constructs as the Bin, Stock, Entrepot, Res, CondQueue, WaitQueue, Transporter and WorkStation, which will be listed before the Queues used in a Model.
        300 - 399 Free for additional Reporters of new constructs that will be listed before the Queues used in a Model.
        200 - 299 Queues. Queue will be sorted first, ProcessQueue last
        100 - 199 Distributions. The generic DistributionReporter will be last with its GroupID of 100.
        1-99 Free for additional Reporters of new constructs that will be listed after the Queues used in a Model.

      • columns

        protected java.lang.String[] columns
        The column headings of this reporter. Reporters of the same group always have the same column headings. Entries should contain in the elements in the same order as the entries[].

      • entries

        protected java.lang.String[] entries
        The data entries of this reporter. Reporters of the same group always have the same number of entries. Entries should contain in the data elements in the same order as defined in the columns[] array.

      • groupHeading

        protected java.lang.String groupHeading
        The group's heading of this class of reporters. The String containe here is used as a table heading. All reporters of the same group must have the same group heading.

      • source

        protected Reportable source
        The Reportable that this reporter generates the report about

      • numColumns

        protected int numColumns
        The number of columns this reporter produces.

      • getColumnTitles

        public java.lang.String[] getColumnTitles()
        Returns an array of Strings each containing the title for the corresponding entry in array entries[].
        Returns:
        java.lang.String[] : Array containing column titles

      • getEntries

        public abstract java.lang.String[] getEntries()
        Returns an array of strings each containing the data for the corresponding column in array columns[]. Implement this method the an array of the same length as the columntitles is produced containing the data at the point of time this method is called by someone else to produce up-to-date information.
        Returns:
        java.lang.String[] : Array containing the data for reporting

      • getGroupID

        public int getGroupID()
        Returns the ID of the group this reporter belongs to. The group-ID is used to give reporters a key to be ordered by. This allows reporters of the same group to be printed together in one table in a report file.
        Returns:
        int : The reporter's group ID

      • getHeading

        public java.lang.String getHeading()
        Returns the heading for the group this reporter belongs to. This can easily be used as a heading in the reporter to introduce a new group of reporters.
        Returns:
        java.lang.String : The group heading for this group of reporters

      • getModel

        public Model getModel()
        Returns the Model that the Reportable belongs to that this reporter produces a report about.
        Returns:
        Model : The Model the reporter's reportable belongs to

      • getReportable

        public Reportable getReportable()
        Returns the reportable object that this reporter contains informations about.
        Returns:
        desmoj.core.simulator.Reportable : The reportable this reporter carries information about
